<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the object damage in the range from 0 to 1. Alias of [[damage]]. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[getDammage]] object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1 </name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1 </name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _damage = [[getDammage]] [[player]];</code> 

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[damage]], [[setDamage]], [[setDammage]], [[setHit]], [[getHit]], [[getHitIndex]], [[setHitIndex]], [[getHitPointDamage]], [[setHitPointDamage]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 9, 2011 - 13:10 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:Demonized|Demonized]]
<dd class="note">
[[getDammage]] and [[damage]] work fine when used on damaged vehicles after a repair from a repairtruck when used in A2 CO patch 1.59.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 31, 2007‎ - 04:25 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]
<dd class="note">
In '''OFP 1.96''', it is possible for a unit to be dead and still return a getDammage value well below 1. Use ![[alive]] to check if a unit is dead.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 13 August 13, 2006‎  - 12:29 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:UNN|UNN]]
<dd class="note">
'''In OFP''' vehicles repaired in game with the Repair trucks e.t.c never get completely repaired. After being repaired, rather than returning 0 when the [[damage]] command is called. They return a value equal to or less than 0.09. 

Consequently any vehicle flagged as immobile (as indicated by the [[canMove]] command), remains so. At least as far as the AI are concerned. The AI will refuse to board an immobile vehicle or eject straight after boarding. Players remain unaffected and can drive the vehicle as normal. To circumvent this, use [[setDamage]] 0 on the vehicle in question, to allow the AI to board.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
